snippet: After years of low self-esteem, feeling alone, poor relationships and drug use, a mother turns her life around to take care of her family.
abstract: Jewish Child Care Association of New York, beneficiary of UJA-Federation of New York,  draws $885 to pay for clothes and a bed for Julie Rodriguez of the South Bronx, who has turned her life around to take care of her family.
lead_paragraph: After years of low self-esteem, feeling alone, poor relationships and drug use, a mother turns her life around to take care of her family.

headline.print_headline: A Mother Fought to End a Destructive Path and Reunite Her Family
headline.seo: A Mother Fought to End a Destructive Path to Reunite Her Family
headline.main: A Mother Fought to End a Destructive Path and Reunite Her Family

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
